revised_title: Exploiting Plant Breeding Techniques for Disease Resistance in Cereals
tldr: The article discusses the importance of disease resistance in cereals, particularly against yellow rust, and explores various plant breeding techniques to develop resistant varieties. The authors highlight the challenges of using major gene and field-resistance mechanisms and suggest that a combination of both offers more promise. They also introduce a new approach, Fx-hybrid varieties, to exploit inter-varietal and inter-specific sources of resistance.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
